Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, stacking the effects on top of each other. 
001 |   Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, stacking the effects on top of each other. 
002 |   For the next minute, you can see any invisible creature if you have line of sight to it.
003 |   A modron chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears a minute later.
004 |   You cast Fireball as a 3rd-level spell centered on yourself.
005 |   You cast Magic Missile as a 5th-level spell.
006 |   Roll a d10. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you shrink. If the roll is even, you grow.
007 |   You cast Confusion centered on yourself.
008 |   For the next minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns.
009 |   You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze, at which point the feathers explode out from your face.
010 |   You cast Grease centered on yourself.
011 |   Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the next spell you cast in the next minute that involves a saving throw.
012 |   Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. A Remove Curse spell can end this effect.
013 |   An eye appears on your forehead for the next minute. During that time, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
014 |   For the next minute, all your spells with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
015 |   You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.
016 |   You are transported to the Astral Plane until the end of your next turn, after which time you return to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
017 |   Maximize the damage of the next damaging spell you cast within the next minute.
018 |   Roll a d10. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you get younger (minimum 1 year old). If the roll is even, you get older.
019 |   1d6 flumphs controlled by the DM appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you and are frightened of you. They vanish after 1 minute.
020 |   You regain 2d10 hit points.
021 |   You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While a plant, you are incapacitated and have vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 hit points, your pot breaks, and your form reverts.
022 |   For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.
023 |   You cast Levitate on yourself.
024 |   A unicorn controlled by the DM appears in a space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
025 |   You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
026 |   A spectral shield hovers near you for the next minute, granting you a +2 bonus to AC and immunity to Magic Missile.
027 |   You are immune to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next 5d6 days.
028 |   Your hair falls out but grows back within 24 hours.
029 |   For the next minute, any flammable object you touch that isn't being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame.
030 |   You regain your lowest-level expended spell slot.
031 |   For the next minute, you must shout when you speak.
032 |   You cast Fog Cloud centered on yourself at your highest slot level.
033 |   Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take 4d10 lightning damage.
034 |   You are frightened by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
035 |   Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes invisible for the next minute. The invisibility ends on a creature when it attacks or casts a spell.
036 |   You gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
037 |   A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes poisoned for 1d4 hours.
038 |   You glow with bright light in a 30-foot radius for the next minute. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you is blinded until the end of its next turn.
039 |   You cast Polymorph on yourself. If you fail the saving throw, you turn into a sheep for the spell's duration.
040 |   Illusory butterflies and flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of you for the next minute.
041 |   You can take one additional action immediately.
042 |   Each creature within 30 feet of you takes 1d10 necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt.
043 |   You cast Mirror Image.
044 |   You cast Fly on a random creature within 60 feet of you.
045 |   You become invisible for the next minute. During that time, other creatures can't hear you. The invisibility ends if you attack or cast a spell.
046 |   If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the Reincarnate spell.
047 |   Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
048 |   You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to poison damage for the next minute.
049 |   You are surrounded by faint, ethereal music for the next minute.
050 |   A 5ft wide wooden cage materializes around you. It can be destroyed from the outside with a DC 13 strength check or a hit with AC 10. From the inside the bars are wide enough to reach through. Breaking out requires a DC 16 strength check. 
051 |   If you are outside, you cast warding wind on yourself. The effect does not follow you, and you are not exempt from its effect. If you are in a room no more than 50ft in any direction, you instead cast dust devil in the center. It has no allegiance. 
052 |   Your flesh becomes transparent and amorphous. For the next minute, you are considered an ooz, and have the amorphous trait.
053 |   You cast gaseous form on a random creature in range or yourself. The effect cannot be dispelled until it expires, and does not require concentration.
054 |   For a minute, everybody around you looks like giant tentacles. You cannot discern them, and you can’t hear when they speak.
055 |   All creatures in the nearest 30ft are affected by the entangle spell, but the roots are snakes. The save DC is your spell save DC. These snakes last at most a minute.
056 |   A single zombie appears in an open space you can see. It has an intelligence of 6, can’t speak but understands common. It is pacifist, and uses sign language to express its love of dance. Dancing with it appeases it. Once a day has passed or it is appeased, it expires.
057 |   You genderswap until your next long rest.
058 |   All spell effects you cast are invisible for the next minute.
059 |   All food is tasteless for 3 days.
060 |   The next thing you touch becomes covered by a thin layer of frost. If it is a creature it manifests as 1d8 cold damage. If an object, it becomes slippery and cold, and requires a dex 13 save to not slip when walking over.
061 |   For the next minute, your alignment is inverse.
062 |   While you are conscious and in range, you are concentrating on this effect instead of any spells. In the surrounding 30ft, all spells cast have their areas of effect doubled.
063 |   The floor is lava. Starting at the end of your turn and until a minute passes, all surfaces in 50ft. that can be considered floor appear as magma rock. Ending your turn on the rock does 2d8 fire damage. Inanimate objects don’t seem affected by this.
064 |   For the next 24 hours, you look like a skeleton and do not require food. Attempting to consume food will make it fall through your ribcage. Upon close examination, you see this is just an illusion spell, but food still falls through.
065 |   A small cloud over your head rains down 100 copper coins. Make a dex 18 save. On a failure, you take 2d8 bludgeoning damage, on a success you take half.
066 |   Roll on the short term madness table.
067 |   Every time you take a step, your feet squeak. You have disadvantage on dex saves for the next five minutes.
068 |   Lemons hover in the air every five feet in the surrounding 30ft. If a creature rolls a 1 on an attack or save, a lemon is hit and sprays in their eyes, dealing 1d4 acid damage and blinding the creature for a turn. If they get a 20 the effect happens to the target/ save instigator.
069 |   Everyone hates you. Each creature within 30ft of you must attack you to the best of their ability on their next turn.
070 |   In a random open space you can see, an invisible gelatinous cube occupies a 10ft cube. It is sleeping, and disappears after it has done 30 damage.
071 |   Minimize the damage of the next damaging spell you cast within the next minute.
072 |   Magical attacks in a 30f. cube around you are considered non magical, and vise-a-versa. This lasts an hour. 
073 |   There is an incendiary lemon in your backpack. Taking damage while holding it will necessitate a dex 10 save to keep it stable. Failing the check or throwing it will cause an effect similar to a molotov cocktail, but with double damage and a mist that smells like lemonade. 
074 |   The next object you touch is stuck to your hand for an hour. Water washes off this glue. 
075 |   You grow two additional arms that are not of the same race as you. They disappear after a minute and anything they were holding falls to the ground. 
076 |   A red ring appears 30 ft around you. When a creature in the ring takes damage, all creatures in the ring take that damage. Resistances and immunities count and it can trigger reactions.
077 |   You Cast polymorph on yourself and turn into a giant wolf spider for the spell’s duration. 
078 |   For an hour your charisma bonus swaps with your highest ability score bonus, or becomes +5 if it has to swap with itself.
079 |   Three creatures you can see are attacked by swarms of bees that appear out of thin air. They have initiative 0 and after their turn is over they disperse. 
080 |   You get Large chicken wings. You can use them to levitate a foot over the ground at most. They disappear in a minute. 
081 |   1d4 Steam and Magma Mephits appear and attack any creature around them. They disappear after 1 minute.
082 |   Your legs (if you have them) are replaced by an elk lower half, centaur style Your walking speed is 50ft but you are a herbivore. Smaller creatures can ride you. 
083 |   For the next hour, you sweat a liter every minute. If you are in a hot place, the amount doubles. If you are in combat, it also doubles. 
084 |   A mysterious insidious force echoes the words “YOU ARE NOW CONSCIOUS OF YOUR BREATH”. Every creature 50 ft around you must take their next bonus action to take a breath because it’s no longer automatic. 
085 |   An NPC angel and a demon hover over either shoulder. You are the only one who hears them. Alternatingly, one suggests lawful good courses of action and the other chaotic evil. Every turn make Wisdom 15 saves or follow their suggestions.
086 |   Make a constitution saving throw to your spell save DC. If you fail, you instantly fall into a deep sleep. Undisturbed, you can sleep for a full week. Half your health in damage wakes you up. 
087 |   The surrounding 30ft becomes a circle of inverse gravity for the next minute. The height of this circle is also 30ft. 
088 |   You cast sleet storm centered on yourself. It looks and tastes like ash. From within the circle everything looks grayscale, and you cannot discern colors. 
089 |   You grow horns. A long rest gets rid of them. 
090 |   Illusory copies of each creature in the surrounding 30ft appear at random locations in the surrounding 50ft. Their movement makes them indistinguishable from the real ones, and they can call out in combat, imitating their original creature to seem equally real. They are unaligned except to seem like the real creature. 
091 |   You cast erupting Earth on a random space you can see. 
092 |   You cast Mass Healing Word. 
093 |   Your skin catches fire, for the next minute while you are burning, you have immunity to fire damage, but everything flammable within five feet of you catches fire. You have disadvantage on constitution checks in water. 
094 |   You realize you are holding a longsword-length leak. If there was a weapon or spellcasting focus in your hand it is stored away on your person. The leak is an improvised weapon. 
095 |   You understand animals for the next minute.  
096 |   You have advantage on your next attack and disadvantage on your next skill check. 
097 |   Your intelligence score becomes 4 for the next minute. 
098 |   Your skin turns pale and your teeth grow into fangs. For the next minute you have disadvantage on checks made while in sunlight, but for every ten hit points of damage you do you gain 1 hit point of temporary health that lasts until the effect is over. 
099 |   Reality warps around you. Your melee attack ranges double. Hallways seem longer, functioning as difficult terrain and being perceived as stretching before your eyes. Plains and open areas at least 50ft wide have the inverse effect, your walking distance is doubled in them. You have advantage on dexterity saves to effects that target you from range. 
100 |   You regain all expended sorcery points.
101 |   Your spellcasting modifier and strength modifier flip for a minute. 
102 |   All weapons and items being held in hand in the surrounding 30ft get thrown upward 30ft
103 |   Swords levitate around you. Every time you are attacked by melee, the attacker must make a dex save equal to your spell save DC or take 2d8 piercing damage. Trying to move from your current space will force you to make the same save. These disappear after a minute. 
104 |   Three extradimensional spaces open up on random 5ft squares in visible range. They appear absolutely indistinguishable from the surrounding ground unless interacted with. They are spike traps that do 2d10 piercing damage when fallen into. Once triggered they disappear. 
105 |   You become ethereal and translucent. Non Magical attacks have disadvantage against you, but you are vulnerable to force and psychic damage. THis effect lasts until the end of your next turn. 
106 |   For the next minute, You are partially incorporeal. You can make a dex saving throw against a creature's hit result as a reaction to let bludgeoning attacks pass through you. You can also reach your arms through thin solid objects. 
107 |   For the next minute, insulting creatures invariably does 1d4 psychic damage to them if they fail a wisdom 10 save. 
108 |   You cast slow on the  last person you targeted with a spell or attack, negative or positive. If you haven’t targeted anyone since your last long rest you instead cast it on yourself. The spell save DC is your own (13 by default).
109 |   For the next minute smoke billows from you. The smoke is not illusory. It doesn’t hurt you and cannot ignite flammable materials, but fills enclosed spaces as expected and can cause suffocation like normal smoke would. 
110 |   You are Stunned until the start of your next turn, believing something awesome just happened.
111 |   You cast Gust of Wind centered on yourself and facing a random direction. 
112 |   You cast Detect Thoughts on the last creature you spoke to. If you haven’t spoken to anyone since your last long or short rest you instead take 1d6 psychic damage.
113 |   You cast Stinking Cloud centered on any point you are in range of. The cloud smells like dead fish. 
114 |   You don’t need to breathe for the next minute. Attempting to do so anyway stuns you until the effect ends. 
115 |   Heavy rain falls in a 60-foot radius centered on the target. The area becomes lightly obscured. The rain falls until the start of your next turn. The rain douses any open flames. All the water adds up to 5 feet cubed by the end of the effect. 
116 |   An animal appears in the unoccupied space nearest the target. The animal isn't under your control and acts as it normally would. Roll a d100 to determine which animal appears.: 1-20 Octopus, 20-40 Badger, 40-60 Baboon, 60-80 Goat, 80-00 Giant Crab
117 |   Illusory butterflies flutter out of your hands until the start of your next turn. Each creature that can see you must make a Wis 18 check or be affected by the enthral spell. The creature doesn’t have to be able to hear you.
118 |   You are affected by the enlarge component of the enlarge/reduce spell. 
119 |   You are affected by the reduce component of the enlarge/reduce spell. 
120 |   Grass grows on the ground in a 60-foot radius centered on you. If grass is already there, it grows to ten times its normal size and remains overgrown for 1 minute.
121 |   An object of the DM 's choice disappears into the Ethereal Plane. The object must be neither worn nor carried, within 120 feet of the target, and no larger than 10 feet in any dimension.
122 |   Leaves grow from a random creature or point you can see. Unless they are picked off, the leaves turn brown and fall off after 24 hours. The leaves are highly flammable, adding +1 to any saves made against the creature or space being doused. 
123 |   A burst of colorful shimmering light extends from you in a 30-foot radius. You and each creature in the area that can see must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become Blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Effect on itself on a success.
124 |   Target a creature. Both of you must make separate dex saves of 13 or be frozen solid. This ice counts as petrification, but thaws in the presence of fire or after a short or long rest. A frozen creature is vulnerable to all damage, but is resistant to fire, which instead thaws it.
125 |   For the next hour you forget common and instead know a random exotic language at the DM’s discretion. 
126 |   You turn into an elemental composed of the last object you touched within the last minute, becoming an earth, water, air, or fire elemental respectively. This lasts for one minute, until this second form reaches 0 hp and brings you back to your normal form, or you use a bonus action to detransform.
127 |   A ten foot long tentacle bursts out of the ground at a random point within 20 feet of you. If a creature is standing in the space where the tentacle appears, it must make a dex 13 save or become grappled by it. When not grappling, the tentacle is unaligned, has a +5 to hit and does 1d4 bludgeoning damage. It has 8 hit points and AC 10. 
128 |   A 20 foot long, five foot wide, twenty foot tall wall of fire appears in an open space within visible range as though the spell “Wall of Fire” was cast. The damage associated is instead 2d8. This wall dispels in one minute.
129 |   A random mundane object not being equipped within twenty feet of you has the spell locate object cast on it by you. For the next 10 minutes you know exactly where it is and what direction it is moving in. 
130 |   You grow another pair of legs. This usually manifests as a lower centaur half. Your natural walking speed increases to 40 unless it is already larger. This effect lasts for the next hour. 
131 |   The next door or trap door you begin to open has the spell arcane lock cast on it before you can do so. The arcane lock only blocks you from entry. There is no password, and the effect lasts until you are more than 50ft away from it. 
132 |   You now understand the nearest creature that would be affected by beast speech, but all you hear from it is ceaseless screaming. This effect lasts a minute. If there are no such creatures in visible range you instead hear the screaming from an unrecognizable point in space. 
133 |   Your skin becomes pale and taught, and your eyes sunken. For the next minute you count as an undead. 
134 |   The next creature you touch you cast the spell inflict wounds on. 
135 |   Your hands turn into slimy tentacles for 1d4 hours. You can still hold and use objects, though you do not have opposable thumbs. You have disadvantage using any kind of tools or instruments. 
136 |   If you cast a spell within the last minute you cast it again for free, targeting the same creature you originally targeted. 
137 |   You grow a peacock tail that will wither in 24 hours. For that duration you have a +1 bonus to your charisma checks. 
138 |   Choose a creature you can see. You switch positions with that creature. 
139 |   The sky above, when viewed from a point in a thirty meter circle around you at the time of triggering, appears to be a dazzling starry sky. 
140 |   Wind picks up speed in a 30ft circle around you, creating the eye of a storm. A cylindrical wall of air, five feet thick and thirty feet high surrounds you. You cannot see through the wall, and it is considered difficult terrain.Any creatures standing in the wall or trying to enter it from outside must make a Dex 18 check or be pushed out. Flying creatures caught in the wall must make the same check but they will also stop flying if they fail the check. This wall lasts for the next minute.
141 |   You cast erupting earth centered on yourself. 
142 |   For the next minute the elements understand you and obey you to a minor degree. You can cast mold earth, shape water, control flames, or gust at will. 
143 |   One dead humanoid body you can see in range has the spell animate dead cast on it. It has no allegiance and attacks indiscriminately. Every turn it will use it’s action to attack a creature or, if it can’t, take action to be able to.
144 |   You cast catapult with DC 15 on the nearest object not being worn or carried. It flies at the nearest creature. 
145 |   All creatures within a 50 food circle of you must make a DC 15 con save or become horribly intoxicated for a minute. While intoxicated they have disadvantage on attack rolls. 
146 |   The next spell you cast roll a d4. If you get 1 you must choose a different spell of the same level. You can choose to cancel casting the spell after rolling the d4, but the spell slot is still wasted. 
147 |   Your weapon or arcane focus grows a single eyeball. It is now considered a sentient magical object that has no locomotion but can communicate telepathically with creatures at most ten feet away from it. 
148 |   A cloud materializes over your head. For the duration of an hour it rains swamp water on you. At random intervals, fish, rotting seaweed, and egg shells may also fall out of the cloud.
149 |   A wooden crate lands in a random visible open space with a cat inside. Roll a d4. If you roll 1 or 2 the cat is dead. On a 3 or 4 the cat is alive and sleeping inside. 
150 |   The space you are standing on becomes difficult terrain. A successful DC 6 perception check will reveal the space to be swamped with assorted sliced fruit. 
151 |   3d8 Kobolds appear in an unoccupied space and begin making a shrine in your honor then disappear when finished in twelve hours. They use natural materials in the surrounding area to accomplish this.
152 |   A single mushroom grows somewhere on a visible part of your body. It is edible but ripping it out does 1d4 psychic damage. 
153 |   Make a Con 10 save every time you cast a cantrip in the next hour. If you fail you can only speak beast speech until the effect ends. 
154 |   A potato appears in your carried equipment or in an open hand. For the next hour the potato reappears in your equipment even if you drop or destroy it. 
155 |   The nearest plant becomes an awakened shrub. Until it moves you cannot tell which plant is awakened. It is very exploratory and does not attack unless provoked. 
156 |   You revert to the amount of hit points you had at the start of your last turn, or if out of combat to the amount you had before the last rest. 
157 |   You lose concentration on any spells you are concentrating on, and an antimagic field surrounds you for the next minute.
158 |   You Suddenly grow a second pair of teeth behind your regular ones that fall out in 24 hours. For the next 24 hours any teeth you lose will regrow in ten minutes. 
159 |   You become affected as if you just drank a philter of love.

161 |   Up to 3 corpses within 30 feet of you rise as zombies hostile to all non-undead creatures.
162 |   Your body and all your gear take on a glassy appearance for the next minute. During this time, ranged attacks that target you bounce off and target other random creatures within 30 feet of you instead.
163 |   For the next minute, the only languages you know are Deep Speech, Primordial, and Sylvan.
164 |   Your body (none of your clothing or gear) teleports 10 feet in a random direction.
165 |   You cast Tasha’s hideous laughter on the nearest creature to you. If there is no other creature within range, you target yourself.
166 |   A deck of many things appears hovering in front of you expectantly. It is an illusion that can only be discerned by touch. It disappears at the end of your next turn.
167 |   If you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage within the next minute, you gain resistance to that type of damage for 1 minute.

169 |   You cast haste on yourself. To people around you you appear to be rapidly vibrating.

171 |   An overexcited flock of colorful birds (use the stat block of a swarm of ravens) appears in your space and attacks you. The flock disappears 1 minute later.
172 |   You see briefly into the future. Roll a d20. The next time a creature makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, the number rolled will be replaced by what you rolled. Make a Jojo reference.

193 |   A column 1d10 feet high and 5 feet in diameter rises beneath your feet. If this height causes it to collide with a ceiling or object above you, you are restrained and take 2d6 bludgeoning damage, pinned against the object, unless you use your reaction to succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw to jump off. The column slowly lowers into the ground 1 minute later, leaving no trace of it.
194 |   A coil of 50 feet of hempen rope immediately appears and ties you up. You are restrained. A creature can break the ropes by dealing 5 slashing or fire damage to them or by succeeding on a DC 11 (Strength) Athletics check. You can also escape with a successful DC 11 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check.

197 |   You take 2d10 psychic damage. This damage can’t reduce your hit points below 1.
198 |   You switch souls with a random creature within 30 feet of you. You control it on its next turn, and it controls you on your next turn. You go back to your regular bodies at the end of your next turn, if the body is still alive.

200 |   You open a window into the far realms, tormenting the weave and breaking reality. The sky turns red and clouds gather. It begins to rain eggs. If a creature is hit by an egg it takes 1d8 psychic damage and is covered in sticky yolk. For the next minute you are made of stardust, glowing like a window into starry space. You can use your walking speed to travel in any direction, neglecting water or gravity. You have the following actions available to you on your turn. Any creature that can cast spells in the nearest mile radius knows your exact location. You choose two creatures you can see and swap their locations. You move five feet cubed of loose nonliving matter including dirt, water, fire, corpses, etc. from a spot you can see within 30ft to another spot. You can target a creature and declare that the next spell they cast will trigger wildmagic. You can force a concentration save on any creature concentrating on a spell within 30ft. You can cast thaumaturgy, prestidigitation, or minor illusion(10ft cube) at will. You can only have one instance of the non-instantaneous effects of this spell active at a time. After a minute reality regains composure and you roll for permanent madness and fall unconscious. 
201 |   A small swarm of tiny modron drones appears in the nearest unoccupied space. They have a fly speed of 20ft, will not move more than 45 feet away from you, and attack any creature you target for a lethal d4 of damage. AC 13, 20hp, resistance to piercing or slashing. After a minute they disappear. 
202 |   A wave of sugar water, 10 feet cubed in volume, washes over you. Make a dex 12 save or be knocked prone. Anyone else in the line of the wave will also make the check. The water does not dispel.
203 |   For the next minute a floating eyeball circles in a 10ft sphere around you, always looking at the nearest creature. You may verbally command it to look in a particular direction as a bonus action. If a spell targets “a place you can see” you can instead cast it through the eyeball. 
204 |   A sudden spray of mercury flies out of either your focus, component pouch, or hand. Cast acid splash in the direction you are facing. The mercury disappears soon after.
205 |   A burst of colorful wooden toy bricks erupt out of you, landing in a 15ft diameter circle around you. They work like caltrops and do not dispel.

207 |   You are no longer able to smell as everything smells like skunk spray. This effect can be dispelled by any spell that removes curses or status effects.
208 |   A solid ball of moss appears around your head. It takes an action to remove. 
209 |   You are teleported to a random unoccupied space within the nearest mile.
210 |   For the next minute you cannot touch or be touched by metal of any kind. It simply passes through you. When the effect  resolves you get pushed out into the nearest unoccupied space.
